import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
from io import BytesIO
import base64

plt.style.use('seaborn')
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.set_palette('husl')

data = [[50.0, 120.0, 70.0, 150.0, 45.0, 100.0]]
box = ax.boxplot(data, patch_artist=True)
box['boxes'][0].set_facecolor('lightblue')
ax.set_ylabel('Values')
ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')

plt.title('Salary Distribution', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
plt.tight_layout()

# Save to base64
buffer = BytesIO()
plt.savefig(buffer, format='png', dpi=100)
buffer.seek(0)
image_base64 = base64.b64encode(buffer.read()).decode()
plt.close()
print(image_base64)
description: Data extracted from user request for Salary Distribution showing an upward trend from 50.00 to 100.00
insights: Peak at Point 5 (150.00), lowest at Point 7 (45.00)
